captions.text:
- People seem to think
being quiet is a bad thing.
People talk over you a lot,
they assume you're an introvert.
Sometimes they just forget you're there.
But, there are also perks of being quiet.
BuzzFeed presents Perks of being quiet.
First off, you say fewer stupid things.
- That color goes great with your skin.

- And what does my skin
normally look like?
- No, I just was saying because the...
- Yeah, rude.

- That color looks really
nice on you, Daisha.
- Thank you!

- People think of you as
being a good listener.
- Anyway, thank you so much,
nobody listens as well as you do.
- You're welcome.
Everyone thinks you're mysterious.
You can sneak out of situations
you don't want to be in.

And when you laugh, people
take it as a sign that

something is really funny,
because you rarely do.
People are blown away when you
say something sassy.

- I mean, did you steal
this from Coolio's tour bus?
Finally, when you do talk,
everyone takes you super seriously.
What we should actually do,
is have mini pies and cupcakes.
- I didn't even think of that.
You're like a genius.
For videos that are totally you
subscribe to BuzzFeed violet, subscribe.
BuzzFeed presents.

comments.text:
This is exactly my life!!!! Omg, everything in this video is spot on! 
crazy! Being Quiet and Short has it's perks!!!﻿
comments.author: felli House

comments.text: This is literally me﻿
comments.author: briana claiborne

comments.text:
Another perk about being quiet is you get to hear a lot of other people's 
convocations. As most people either know I wont tell anyone or even realize 
I'm there, they continue to have convocations quite loudly near me. I don't 
mind this as I overhear ALOT of secrets of people from my school, and I 
find out about the latest gossip with out even talking to anyone, Its 
great!﻿
comments.author: Nicola Coombs

comments.text: *Silent river run deep.*﻿
comments.author: oechikr

comments.text:
I'm not so quiet but this is too true. I can sneak out of groups that only 
talk about how they get drunk and bang. It's also true that in my classroom 
they're always discussing unnecesary things and when I give ideas, they get 
surprised and take them. A perk of being quiet is also that you take your 
time to analyze and you don't just fire words.﻿

I don't give 2 shits!﻿

comments.author: Nerdychip

comments.text:
The people at my school used to say things like "We should have a Remi day 
where we're all quiet." or "She should be nominated for quietest for the 
year book." It's annoying because I'm not even all that quiet. Everyone 
just ignores me. A boy even asked me "Are you mute?"
But, people assume that since I'm quiet I won't listen in on their 
conversations, or they're nice to me, or everyone just gets really quiet 
when I'm talking so they can hear me (I am really soft spoken).﻿

comments.text: So true﻿
comments.author: Melody Winter

comments.text:
Some of these are true but it's more like...



I HATE YOU why would I ever talk to you in the first place?  I also love 
being able to just slip away from conversations, like it is as if i'm 
invisible which makes it so nice.  I doubt anyone thinks i'm mysterious as 
I am very lazy, quiet, rather sensitive.  When I make a joke its a SICK 
BURN.  The sassy part is too true.  I only smile when I laugh, so when 
there is something I find enjoyable, it's going to be fucking good.  And I 
gotta say I love a quiet girl/friend, they just... get it.  And to finish 
this I gotta say this quote  "The quiet ones... tend to be the kinky ones."﻿

comments.author: Kacy HD

comments.text:
I totally agree that quiet folks are best at not saying stupid things. Have 
you ever talked to someone who just liked the sound of their own voice? 
Eternal stupid comments seem very prominent on the internet as well.

 I love it when I totally feel like someone's listening 100%. One last 
thing I would like to say is that everybody assumes that quiet people lack 
personality or don't like to have fun. I think we have a lot of 
personality, we just don't really know how to express it all of the time. 
And btw, I love social settings and having fun. Whether you're an introvert 
or extrovert, I think you, the person reading this is awesome! :3﻿

comments.text:
Every time you don't speak is a time you listen ... and learn.
Anyway, I don't know if these perks work more in different cultures, it 
seemed to work in Asia but not in Europe. I'm french, and being quiet 
doesn't make you mysterious or makes your speech more relevant, on the 
contrary, people can be contemptuous.
I agree on the Good Listener thing though.﻿

comments.text:

when I want to be. ﻿

comments.author: MathuBC 1

comments.text:
Haha oh gosh, I can relate to this soooo much. I hate when they ask me why 
I'm so quiet, but the worst is when they tell me to "just talk". Like?? As 
far as I know, I can be pretty talkative with the right people, if I don't 
talk much THEN YOU'RE NOT THE RIGHT PERSON TO TALK TO!
But yeah, recently I've noticed that I'm kinda the validation of if 
something's funny or not. Like "HAHA SEE, SHE LAUGHED , I'M SO FUNNY!!" 
etc. Kinda amusing tbh.
Also, you super talkative people - have you ever thought about the fact 
that maybe you're the one that's talking too much and never giving me the 
time to say something, or interrupting me all the time?? Because that sure 
happens a lot...﻿
comments.author: AllwaysAGirl

comments.text:
Next time someone asks ''Why are you so quiet?'' I'll answer ''Why are you

comments.author: Madeline Horan

comments.text:
Yeah right, unfortunately those perks don't exist.  There's way too much a 
stigma against any sort of individualism in this culture.  You're only seen 
as weird and/or stupid for "being quiet" or thinking out of the box.  I 
don't have a problem with it given that I don't want or need to associate 
myself with all the morons who think that but this shouldn't go without 
saying, unfortunately...﻿
comments.author: Typhoon792

comments.text: When people tell me i quiet i just say well done and your loud﻿

comments.text:
I actually talk a lot and I don't really get nervous (not even when I'm on 
stage and stuff) but my voice is quiet and sometimes I don't feel like 
talking. Everyone says I sound like a fairy. What annoys me though, is when 
people just say "Oh, she's shy" - maybe I don't understand what shy means, 
but I didn't think I was shy...﻿

comments.author: zoro playz

comments.text: If I worked at buzzfeed, me and Andrew would be great friends. ﻿
comments.author: Jordie Hurst

comments.text:
I can totally relate to this video! Quiet people are full of surprises. 
Everything you say or do, people would be amazed by it! I'm a quiet person 
myself and every time I would say something, people would look at me like 
I'm a baby whose just learning how to talk for the very first time! I think 
that people like me are very underrated! We don't get the credit that we 
deserve! People think that I'm mentally retarded just cuz I'm quiet but I'm 
a lot smarter than these dumb mofos! Another thing is that every time I 
would talk to somebody or when somebody's talking to me, the whole world 
would listen and be all up in my business. And people would want to know 
everything about you when you're quiet. I also hate when people would ask 
me questions like, Are you okay? Are you alright? Are you depressed? Is 
there something wrong? That s*** gets on my f***ing nerves! I'm not sad, 
I'm not depressed, I'm just a naturally quiet person!﻿

hard, I broke out crying like an idiot at a school pep rally last Thursday.﻿
